skillTree.localised_description: A Bellower’s voice is as deep as it loud, carrying across the battlefield and encouraging unbridled carnage.
A small handful of Gnoblars surround this Ogre Lord, their swords always ready to cut and carve.
It never hurts to keep your lucky Gnoblar with you, just in case.
Stumpy and short-witted as they are, these Gnoblars have an eye on the sky at all times.
Puny magicks are nothing in the face of the Great Maw's endless hunger.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The Great Maw protects and the Great Maw devours. Hiding in shadows, the meatbags cower!"

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +15% chance of wounding aggressors

skillTree.localised_description: Snapping limbs and smashing skulls – it's all in a day's work for an Ogre Tyrant.
Rule number one of being a leader is to be far more terrifying than the next braggard who thinks they ought to take your place.
The best way to stay out of the pot is to do as the Tyrant says and be happy about it.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -5% for all buildings
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: This Tyrant is the size of several large creatures rolled into one. In fact, he ate those several large creatures just yesterday.
Mountains of gold and an overflowing meat-pot are bound to draw in the strongest of warriors.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: It is not enough to impose military defeat upon the foe, they must be brought to their knees through punitive taxation… unless they'd rather get in the meat-pot instead?
When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
No enemy is immovable when in the path of a furious Ogre's charge.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
This Ogre's greed shall never be sated, for his stomach is as endless as his hunger.
A truly sturdy armour is needed to hold such an overflowing gut in place.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
If the enormous size of this Ogre doesn't incite terror, his bloody, malevolent smile surely will.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When an Ogre charges, the ground itself begins to quake. As it should.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +2 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +8 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Though their intelligence is as pitiful as their physique, one would be a fool not to fear the Gnoblars when massed in numbers.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +4 for Gnoblars and Pigback Riders units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +3 for Gnoblars and Pigback Riders units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Gnoblars and Pigback Riders units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 for Gnoblars and Pigback Riders units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +8 for Gnoblars and Pigback Riders units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: If there's one thing more horrifying than being rushed by a hulking, bloodthirsty beast, it's being rushed by that same creature riding on the back of another equally hulking, bloodthirsty beast.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +4% for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +8% for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +9 for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Ogres' true firepower is as destructive and indelicate as the Ogres themselves.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +3% for Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +12% for Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblaster units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +5% for Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +20% for Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblaster units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +7% for Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even ferocious brutes like the Ironguts and Maneaters fight harder in the presence of a worthy leader.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +2 for Ironguts and Maneaters units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Ironguts and Maneaters units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Ironguts and Maneaters units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Ironguts and Maneaters units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +8 for Ironguts and Maneaters units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: What the monstrous creatures of the mountains lack in guile, they more than make up for in their stubborn reluctance to die.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +4 for Sabretusk Pack, Blood Vultures, Yhetees, Thundertusk, Stonehorn, Gorgers and Giant units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +9 for Sabretusk Pack, Blood Vultures, Yhetees, Thundertusk, Stonehorn, Gorgers and Giant units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +8 for Sabretusk Pack, Blood Vultures, Yhetees, Thundertusk, Stonehorn, Gorgers and Giant units

	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Sabretusk Pack, Blood Vultures, Yhetees, Thundertusk, Stonehorn, Gorgers and Giant units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To the most brutal, vicious killer go the richest spoils.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Ironguts, Gnoblars, Pigback Riders and Ogre Bulls units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Ironguts, Gnoblars, Pigback Riders and Ogre Bulls units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +6% for Ironguts, Gnoblars, Pigback Riders and Ogre Bulls units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When pelting a helpless enemy with heavy projectiles is so much fun, why bother stopping?

effects.description:
Speed: +10% for Gnoblar Trappers, Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Range: +10% for Gnoblar Trappers, Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +15% for Gnoblar Trappers, Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When fearsome, brute strength is combined with terrifying speed, the petty weaklings among the enemy can only wet themselves in fear.

effects.description:
Leadership: +4 for Mournfang Cavalry, Crushers, Stonehorn, Blood Vultures, Thundertusk and Sabretusk Pack units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Mournfang Cavalry, Crushers, Stonehorn, Blood Vultures, Thundertusk and Sabretusk Pack units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +7 for Mournfang Cavalry, Crushers, Stonehorn, Blood Vultures, Thundertusk and Sabretusk Pack units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Driven by ravenous hunger, the Maneaters feast on the flesh of the fallen.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +7 for Maneaters, Gorgers, Yhetees and Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +6% for Maneaters, Gorgers, Yhetees and Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Maneaters, Gorgers, Yhetees and Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: There is no other choice. There never was.
Wealth, greed and glory are enough to make any basic war camp swell in size.
Raiders are good at marauding through enemy settlements - sending their denizens fleeing as their properties are despoiled.

effects.description:
Attrition: -5% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -15% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The mysterious powers of the Great Maw can heal even the deepest of wounds.
Even Ogres are capable of forward planning, especially when it comes to precious loot.
Running a large camp is one thing. Running an effective camp is another entirely.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Ogres flock to this Butcher's camp, eager for the chance to witness the Great Maw's malevolent power.
Flesh, limbs, blood and bone – it all goes into the meat-pot!

effects.description:
Meat gained from battles: +50%
	(this force and all forces in circle of influence)

Meat gained from battles: +100%
	(this force and all forces in circle of influence)

Meat gained from battles: +150%
	(this force and all forces in circle of influence)

skillTree.localised_description: The grumblings of unrest tend to quiet when under threat of being crushed and eaten.
This ravening Ogre Lord is but a mere symbol of his god, whose cancerous power reigns over the Mountains of Mourn.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
When attacking braced charge defenders, this unit only loses half of its charge bonus.
Allows the unit to attack and destroy walls in melee. This attribute also adds a  +50% damage multiplier against buildings.

items.colour_text: In lieu of a proper written language or indeed any level of basic literacy, the Tyrant's achievements are immortalised in pictures on the walls of caves.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +500 metres without incurring any time penalty

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Butchery is an art. This one knows how to extract every last morsel worth eating from a carcass, leaving only bones behind them.

effects.description:
Replenishes 5% campaign movement range after winning a battle
	(own army)

Melee attack: +4 for Lords and embedded Heroes
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The more meat you eat, the stronger and fatter you become, and therefore the harder you are to move from your chosen position.
There may or may not be a height difference between this one and his Ogreish colleagues, but in stature on the battlefield the divergence is most stark.
"Remember, lads, when Great Maw came 'e ate the night, shook the ground and burnt it with fire. That is 'oo we serve, not sum uvver power."

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Magic item drop chance from battle: +5%
